articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Egyptian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Egyptian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Egyptian Ambassador to the DPRK Ismail Abdelrahman Ghoneim Hussein who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Fijian, Iranian Ambassadors
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Fijian, Iranian Ambassadors
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun separately met and had conversations with Esalla Teleni, new Fijian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a courtesy call on him, and Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Morteza Moradian who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Secretary of C.C., WPK Meets Italian Businessman
articles.content:
Secretary of C.C., WPK Meets Italian Businessman 
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) --  Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Wednesday met and had a talk with  Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Italian Businessman
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Italian Businessman
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Giancarlo Elia Valori handed over the gift to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Visits Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Visits Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of the Service Department of Diplomatic Corps of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Vietnam led by Director General Nguyen Van Hoa visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday. 
					 Members of the delegation laid bunches of flowers before the statues before paying tribute to them. 
					
					 The delegation arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Buddhists in North and South Reject S. Korea-Japan Military Information Agreement
articles.content:
Buddhists in North and South Reject S. Korea-Japan Military Information Agreement 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Buddhist Federation of Korea and the Movement for Recovering Cultural Treasures of south Korea released a joint statement Wednesday on the 102nd anniversary of the brigandish fabrication of "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" by the Japanese imperialists.
					 The statement condemned the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea for its behind-the-scenes push for the conclusion of the General Security of Military Information Agreement (GSOMIA) with the Japanese reactionaries. 
					
					 It branded the move as an act of designating the fellow countrymen in the north as "enemy" and standing against the country's reunification for the perpetuation of its division. It went on:
					
					 In the past the Japanese imperialists illegally occupied Korea and inflicted unspeakable misfortune and pain on the Koreans, typically forcible drafting, sexual slavery and forcing Koreans to change their names to Japanese ones. They plundered Korea of its cultural treasures and underground natural resources and committed huge atrocities to obliterate the soul of the nation.
					
					 Far from making an apology and reparation for the past crimes the Japanese imperialists committed against the Koreans, Japan has distorted history and openly laid a territorial claim to Tok Islets in a bid to realize the ambition for invading Korea. It now has gone the lengths of seeking the conclusion of the GSOMIA with south Korea.
					
					 Emboldened by the political and military tie-up with south Korea that has escalated since the Lee Myung Bak regime's taking office, Japan is openly opting for becoming a military power and launching militarist reinvasion. The formation of triangular military alliance among the U.S., Japan and south Korea that has now reached a dangerous phase also stems from the close nexus between south Korea and Japan.
					
					 The joint statement evinced the firm pledge of Buddhists in the north and the south to turn out in practical actions to reject and foil military nexus between the Lee Myung Bak regime and the Japanese reactionaries which increases the danger of a new war on the Korean Peninsula and gravely threatens peace and security in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Reception Given on 45th Anniversary of ASEAN
articles.content:
Reception Given to Mark 45th Anniversary of ASEAN
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry hosted a reception on Wednesday to mark the 45th anniversary of ASEAN.
					 Present there on invitation were Cambodian Ambassador to the DPRK Chhorn Hay who is chairman of the ASEAN Committee here, Vietnamese Ambassador Le Quang Ba, Lao Ambassador Kiettisak Keobanhdith, Indonesian Ambassador Nasri Gustaman, Charge d'affaires ad interim of the Malaysian embassy Mohamad Hasril Abdul Hamid, and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun in a speech at the reception said that Southeast Asia has turned into the region of peace, stability and development from one of disputes, misfortunes and poverty thanks to the efforts of the ASEAN member nations in the past.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il put forward the plan for building independent, peaceful and prospering new Asia and paid deep attention to developing relations with ASEAN countries, Pak noted.
					
					 The DPRK government will as ever strive to consolidate the bonds of friendship and cooperation with ASEAN member nations and ensure durable peace and stability of the region, he added.
					
					 Chhorn Hay said he was pleased with the fact that the DPRK government is taking part in ASEAN meetings and activities, referring to the cooperation being expanded and developed between the DPRK and ASEAN member nations.
					
					 ASEAN has turned into a regional cooperation body covering the whole of Southeast Asia, he said, stressing the need for ASEAN member nations to make positive efforts to discharge their mission.

articles.title: Friendship Gathering with Participants of Int'l Academic Symposium Held
articles.content:
Friendship Gathering with Participants of Int'l Academic Symposium Held
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A friendship gathering with the participants of the international academic symposium of Kim Il Sung University took place at the indoor stadium of the university Wednesday.
					 Present there were foreign delegations and delegates and a delegate of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan to the symposium, Song Ja Rip, minister of Higher Education who is president of the university, officials, teachers and researchers of the university.
					
					 The participants enjoyed a performance given by art circle members of the university, played amusement sports games and danced together, deepening friendship.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Int'l Academic Symposium
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Int'l Academic Symposium
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a letter from the participants in the international academic symposium of Kim Il Sung University on Wednesday.
					 The letter said:
					
					 The symposium held at Kim Il Sung University on the theme of "For social progress and prosperity" was a significant international assembly which took place against the backdrop of ever-increasing desire and efforts of humankind for progress and prosperity.
					
					 The symposium firmly convinced all its participants of the prospect for educational and scientific development which the dear respected Kim Jong Un regards as a strategic task for building a thriving nation.
					
					 We were greatly impressed by the great successes made by Kim Il Sung University in education and science under the difficult situation where everything was in short supply, true to the last instructions of President Kim Il Sung and Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Boosting multifaceted cooperation and exchange in the fields of education, science and technology with the Korean people who have made steady efforts to achieve social progress and prosperity common to humankind will play a great role in bringing earlier the building of a new, independent and prosperous world.
					
					 We will make positive efforts to further deepen international academic exchange and cooperation in education, science and technology in the future, too.

articles.title: Event of Workers and Members of Trade Unions Held
articles.content:
Event of Workers and Members of Trade Unions Held 
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- An event "The great leader General Kim Jong Il is the eternal sun of Songun" was held by workers and trade union members in Pyongyang Wednesday to mark the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 In female solo "Road of the General to Front", female chorus "Jeep Is Running on a Long Trip to Front" and male solo and pangchang "The General Is Great Defender" the performers highly praised the undying feats Kim Jong Il performed by turning the DPRK into an invincible politico-ideological power and military power.
					
					 Ri Kun Sok, vice-chairman of the primary committee of the trade union of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory recollected with deep emotion that Kim Jong Il visited the worksites several times and showed warm loving care for them.
					
					 Kim Yong Ok, worker of the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, renewed their determination to perform feats in building a thriving nation, under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is translating the noble desire of Kim Jong Il into reality.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Vow to Remain True to Songun Revolutionary Leadership
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Vow to Remain True to Songun Revolutionary Leadership
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers met at the Chonsam Co-op Farm, Anbyon County of Kangwon Province, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. 
					 A report by Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers, was followed by speeches. 
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on Aug. 25, 1960, adding that this was a noteworthy event which brought about a turning point in developing the revolutionary armed forces and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 After starting the Songun revolutionary leadership with perfect traits and qualifications as a brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, Kim Jong Il performed undying exploits before the era, revolution, country and its people with his outstanding ideas and extraordinary leadership, they noted, and continued: 
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un a new heyday of building the revolutionary armed forces has been ushered in and the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity and might as an invincible power which no enemy dares provoke. 
					
					 They renewed their resolution to absolutely trust and follow Kim Jong Un, a brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, in one mind and fully display the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and devotedly implementing tasks given by him.

articles.title: Torchlight Relay Racers Pass through Kangwon, South Phyongan Provinces
articles.content:
Torchlight Relay Racers Pass through Kangwon, South Phyongan Provinces
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Members of the young vanguard participating in the torchlight relay race arrived in Wonsan and Phyongsong separately on Tuesday, 8 days after they left Mt. Paektu.
					 Those from the east and west coastal areas handed over the torchlight to those from Kangwon and South Phyongan Provinces.
					
					 They were warmly welcomed by citizens and school youth and students of Wonsan and Phyongsong.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bunches of flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung at Haean Square and the Songdowon International Children's Camp and in Phyongsong City before paying tribute to him.
					
					 Members of the young vanguard of Kangwon Province participating in the torchlight relay race looked round the revolutionary museum in the province, Wonsan University of Agriculture, Songdowon International Children's Camp, etc.
					
					 Poem reciting and singing event "Chol Pass and Youth" was held by youth and students of the province at the Songdowon Youth Open-Air Theatre.
					
					 At the event the young people renewed their determination to carry forward the revolutionary cause of Juche generation after generation, always bearing in mind the touching stories about Chol Pass which leader Kim Jong Il crossed frequently.
					
					 Those of South Phyongan Province took part in the meeting congratulating the innovators of the Sinri Coal Mine in Chongnam District.
					
					 They arrived in Phyongsong City through Mundok and Sukchon counties.
					
					 An oath-taking meeting of youth and students of the province took place before the statue of Kim Il Sung in the city. They pledged to give steady continuity to the march toward Mt. Paektu following the dear respected Kim Jong Un, holding aloft the torchlight of revolution provided by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They renewed their resolution to fully display their spirit and courage at every post and in each worksite.
					
					 They departed from Wonsan and Phyongsong on Wednesday.

articles.title: KCNA Detailed Report on Construction of Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station
articles.content:
KCNA Detailed Report on Construction of Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station 
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released a detailed report on the construction of the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station Wednesday.
					 The heroic epic in the new century is being created at the construction site of the power station, the report says, and goes on:
					
					 The power station consists of three stations in the upper reaches of Sodu Stream in Paekam County, Ryanggang Province. It is a huge project that has to overcome the most unfavorable natural and geographical conditions in the DPRK's history of building hydro-electric power stations.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il let the youth league take charge of the project. The young people completed the construction of Power Station No. 1 earlier than schedule, creating a new youth speed. They have already finished the building of the basic dam of Power Station No. 2 and are pushing forward the expansion of waterway tunnel in its final phase.
					
					 In July 2004, the youth held a meeting to vow to push forward the construction and then laid several kilometer-long road and railways in just 10 days with the same stamina and spirit as displayed by the preceding generation in the projects of laying Haeju-Hasong railway section and building the Youth Hero Motorway.
					
					 A plan was worked out to hasten the project of the first cofferdam for the construction of the dam of Power Station No. 1. This constituted the first phase in the whole project. The builders tackled a temporary drainage setup in keeping with the topographical conditions of the area which is over 1 000 meters above the sea level, thus completing the cofferdam project 15 days earlier than plan.
					
					 This was followed by the successive blasting for the excavation of earth for laying the foundation of the dam and the second cofferdam project.
					
					 The youth introduced new construction method in the second cofferdam project, thus economizing lots of cement and bringing the completion of the project earlier.
					
					 They finished in a matter of six months the creation of gravel and sand dumping ground, assorting ground, mixing ground, nine- conveyer belt project and transport and assembling of a crane for building dam. This would take 2-3 years at an ordinary pace.
					
					 The youth shock brigade started concrete tamping for the dam. They introduced advanced construction method and innovation proposals to lower the inside heat of dam, thus giving great benefits to the state and hastening the speed of construction.
					
					 During 150-day and 100-day campaigns in 2009 they built up scores of meters of dam.
					
					 The water tunnel project of Power Station No. 1, key part in the construction of the power station, was a do-or-die battle.
					
					 The members of the youth shock brigade sometimes stayed under water for more than 70 hours, fighting water pouring from the ceiling.
					
					 They carved words of song "Where Are You, Dear General" on the wall of the tunnel, one line every 100 meters, looking forward to the day when Kim Jong Il would visit the completed power station.
					
					 They dug the maximum of 9.7 meters a day. The distance covered by each person pushing a wagon for hundreds of days till the completion of tunnel amounted to some 12 000 kilometers.
					
					 The waterway was tunneled through for Power Station No. 1 in February 2006. For more than 300 days afterwards, the builders finished the most demanding expansion project and then conducted coating project, thus completing the water tunnel in August 2010.
					
					 This led to the earlier completion of Power Station No. 1 in December 2010.
					
					 The construction of pebbles dam and water tunnel of Power Station No. 2 has also made so big headway that the construction of the basic dam is to be completed on the occasion of the Youth Day this year.
					
					 The expansion project is now under way after the waterway was tunneled through and the construction of Power Station No. 3 is making progress as planned.
					
					 The ideological and moral world of the young people has been upgraded during the period.
					
					 The members of the youth shock brigade paved "Paektu youth road" out of their yearnings for Kim Jong Il and their loyalty for the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They have established the way of life of the anti-Japanese guerillas at lodgings, worksites and all other places. Their ranks and order remind one of the revolutionary traits of the People's Army.
					
					 They brought hundreds of hectares under cultivation, producing various kinds of vegetables on Paekam. They also rear thousands of domestic animals, laying firm supply service bases.
					
					 There were those who readily shoved falling stone to save comrades. When trapped inside crumbled pit, they held rock-drills for tunneling before opening road for their lives.
					
					 An ordinary girl shock brigade member laid down her life to save comrades under unexpected dangerous situation. Written on her diary were letters "Let us rise up first when the country undergoes difficulty!"
					
					 Lots of commanders and members of the shock brigades finished correspondence courses of colleges and became dependable pillars of the country during the construction period.
					
					 Officials of youth league organizations at all levels went to the relevant factories and enterprises where they meticulously organized the work to step up the youth shock brigade activities for increased production, thus bringing about remarkable innovations in the production of electric generators and other equipment and raw materials needed for the construction.
					
					 The manufacture of "Songun Youth Vanguard" electric locomotive and dozens of freight cars helped relieve the strain on the transport. This was a result of a do-good-thing movement including the collection of idle materials conducted by the youth league organizations.
					
					 Young people of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan rendered sincere help to the construction of the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station, keeping pace with the patriotic devotion of those in the homeland.
					
					 The big trust and loving care shown by Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un, peerlessly great men, have become the source of the undying feats at the construction site.
					
					 In May 2010 Kim Jong Il visited the construction site despite his fatigue from foreign visit. He encouraged the members of the youth shock brigade, saying that they have done many things beyond imagination.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un read a letter presented by commanders and members of the Paektusan Songun Youth Shock Brigade in January this year and sent his handwritings and learned about problems arising in the project and life down to the details.
					
					 The day of the completion of the power station is drawing near thanks to the profound loyalty of young people of Mt. Paektu to uphold Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Korean Women Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership
articles.content:
Korean Women Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea held a story-telling meeting at the Women's Hall in Pyongyang on Wednesday to mark the 52nd anniversary of the start of the Songun revolutionary leadership by Kim Jong Il. 
					 The meeting heard touching stories told by those related to the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il, They said how he provided Songun revolutionary leadership with his warm love and deep trust for several decades. 
					
					 Ri Yong Wol, secretary of the primary party committee of the Hotel of Scientists, told her experiences during her military service. 
					
					 She recalled that Kim Jong Il sent medical cream to coast artillery women and visited her company several times to keep the promise he made to come back when the persimmons got ripened. 
					
					 She said that Kim Jong Il enjoyed a performance by soldiers of the company and let the light comedy "Promise" was produced based on a true story about the company. Under his warm loving care and deep trust, she has grown up to be a party official, she added, emotionally singing the song "Tell, Way of Songun". 
					
					 Pak Chang Gum, secretary of the primary party committee in Jongro-dong, Central District, said in excited tones that she, an ordinary woman, became Hero of the DPRK under the care of the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 The story of Paek Ryon Hui, wife of an officer of the Korean People's Army, touched the heartstrings of the audience. She presented a solo drama "Wishes" at the contest of art squads of wives of service personnel provided by Kim Jong Il. She was honored to receive great praises and gifts from him. 
					
					 She told how she became a heroine of a feature film, as a member of the art squad of the military families. The world does not know such blessed women as wives of service personnel who are blooming as azaleas at the trenches, with family-like relations with the Supreme Commander, she stressed.

articles.title: Korean Youth Effect Innovations in Difficult and Labor-consuming Economic Sectors
articles.content:
Korean Youth Effect Innovations in Difficult and Labor-consuming Economic Sectors
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- At least 209 500 young Koreans volunteered to work in difficult and labor-consuming fields of the national economy to make a breakthrough over the last decade. 
					 Many young people volunteered to work on socialist cooperative farms true to the intention of the Workers' Party of Korea to settle food shortage. More than 100 young people of South Phyongan Province proceeded to the Jisa Co-op Farm, Nampho City in 2006. The number of those youngsters has increased year by year since then. 
					
					 After graduating from Pyongyang Agricultural College of Kim Il Sung University, Jong Su Rim volunteered to work on the Rihyon Vegetable Farm in Sadong District. Kim Chong Sun and Ri Po Dap and his 15 other brothers and sisters proceeded to the Chongsan Cooperative Farm, Kangso District, after graduating from Pyongyang Jangwon Secondary School and Pyongyang Kangan Secondary School. Many other young people also volunteered to work on farms last year, too. 
					
					 Young people volunteered to work in major worksites for socialist construction including pilot sectors of the national economy in hearty response to the call of the party.
					
					 Discharged young soldiers volunteered to work in major sectors of the national economy including furnaces of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, coal mines and ore mines. They are playing a pioneer's role in the revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 More than 50 graduates from Kim Chol Ju University of Education proceeded to the construction site of the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station and dozens of those from Kim Jong Suk University of Education and Sariwon University of Education No. 2 to the project for rebuilding and repairing the northern railways.
					
					 Jo Jang Hyang's eight brothers and sisters of Pyongyang Munsin Secondary School and graduates from Pyongyang Jangchung Secondary School, Pyongyang Puksu Secondary School, Wonsan Orphans' Secondary School and other secondary schools proceeded to worksites for effecting a great surge including the Ryongyang Mine, Komdok Mining Complex, etc.
					
					 Young people across the country are playing their roles as vanguard and shock brigade in building an economic power. Kim Hyok Youth Shock Brigade and Cha Kwang Su Youth Shock Brigade are taking the lead in the drive for socialist construction including the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, Unryul Mine, Sochang Youth Coal Mine, Namdok Coal Mine and Ripsok Coal Mine. 
					
					 Members of the Paektusan Songun Youth Shock Brigade have displayed matchless devotion despite difficulties, bringing earlier the day of completion of the power station. Innovations are being effected every day by members of the youth shock brigade through their high-pitched drive in the project for rebuilding and repairing the northern railways. 
					
					 Young people of power basses in Huichon, Pyongyang and Pukchang, coals mines in Sunchon and Anju areas and Songgang and Hwanghae iron and steel production bases and in the field of railway transport are effecting a great surge in production.
					
					 In the rural areas the number of youth sub-workteams and workteams increased to thousands. Among them more than 200 units won twice model youth sub-workteam (workteam) title and at least 120 thrice model youth sub-workteam (workteam) title.
					
					 Young people are playing a big role in settling scientific and technological issues arising in building a thriving nation true to the party's idea of attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 Youth march for science and technology and the national youth exhibition of scientific and technological achievements, etc. are brisk in the country. This year, too, young scientists, technicians and inventors presented thousands of valuable computer programs and technological innovation proposals conducive to technological updating of different sectors of the national economy and modernization of production processes, holding high the banner of the industrial revolution in the new century.

articles.title: Celebrations of Youth Day in Preparation in DPRK
articles.content:
Celebrations of Youth Day in Preparation in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Preparations for celebrations of the Youth Day (Aug. 28) are gaining momentum in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Kim Chol Ung, a department director of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, told KCNA:
					
					 "Various events are to be held in celebrations of the Youth Day.
					
					 The preparatory committee for celebrations of the Youth Day is under operation and delegates to the celebrations were already selected. 
					
					 A national exhibition of sci-tech achievements by young Koreans is taking place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition.
					
					 Colorful art performances are put on stages by young people of industrial establishments and contests of art agitation squads of students and youth under way throughout the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, the country is seethed with diverse political, cultural and sports activities, creating climate for the day."
					
					 Kim Kwang Chol, a department director of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said:
					
					 "Young people of industrial establishments are boosting production with the approach of the Youth Day.
					
					 Young employees at the Mangyongdae Garment Factory, Songyo Knitted Goods Factory, Sadong Garment Factory and other light industrial establishments have already fulfilled their yearly assignments.
					
					 Many young men and women distinguish themselves in construction projects.
					
					 The celebrations will fully demonstrate the high spirit of young Koreans striving hard for the prosperity of the country under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: Int'l Investment Forum Held in Rason, DPRK
articles.content:
Int'l Investment Forum Held in Rason, DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- An international forum on investment in the Rason Economic and Trade Zone (RETZ) took place in Rason City in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Tuesday.
					 It was attended by participants in the 2nd Rason International Trade Fair, which opened on Monday.
					
					They watched videos on natural and geographical conditions and development situation of the RETZ and its prospect.
					
					 They were briefed on laws concerning the development of the zone, regulations for launching and operating foreign-invested businesses, foreign business activities and tourist industry in the zone.
					
					Kim Yong Nam, a vice-director of the Rason City People's Committee, said the RETZ will turn into a hub of transit transport, trade, investment and financial and tourism services, as well as an international port city in ten 10 years.
					
					 Zhang Xingquan, director general of the Siping Lishan Machinery Manufacturing Co., Ltd. in China, said the zone development will be profitable and expressed his intention to launch a joint venture in the city.

articles.title: Officials in DPRK Express Will to Wipe out Invaders
articles.content:
Officials in DPRK Express Will to Wipe Out Invaders
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave an order during his inspection of the island defence detachments stationed in the southernmost part of the southwest front, the biggest hotspot. The order made all the officials across the country aboil with the firm will to wipe out the enemy.
					 Kim Jong Chol, a commanding official of the Kaesong City Youth Shock Brigade, said that the order of the supreme commander gives all the people thousand-fold strength and courage, expressing belief that they are sure to win victory as there is the great brilliant Songun commander with matchless courage and pluck. 
					
					 Our revolutionary armed forces led by him will deal an annihilating blow to the enemies if a conflict breaks out, Kim Jong Chol said, adding that the enemies should clearly know that the DPRK will not show any mercy to the provokers. 
					
					 Song Yun Hui, management board chairwoman of the Migok Co-op Farm in Sariwon City, said: If the enemies force a war on us, the agricultural workers together with the People's Army will wipe out all the invaders by waging our-own style sacred war true to the order of the Supreme Commander. 
					
					 Ko Chang Do, chairman of the Tongrim County People's Committee, expressing his resolution to take revenge, said:
					
					 The people of the Tongrim County are full of the will to turn out in the just war of retaliation and mercilessly wipe out the U.S. imperialists and their stooges.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK under the great Songun brilliant commander will never pardon those invading the inviolable territory of the country. 
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists and south Korean group of traitors recklessly fire even a bullet at the DPRK, all its army and people will never miss the opportunity but deal telling strikes to the enemies and achieve national reunification.

articles.title: Members of Young Vanguard Vow to Fulfill Order Issued by Supreme Commander
articles.content:
Members of Young Vanguard Vow to Fulfill Order Issued by Supreme Commander 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The news about the field inspection of the island defence detachments in the southernmost part of the southwest front, the biggest hotspots, provided by Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un is greatly inspiring all members of young vanguard in the DPRK in their resolution to defend the country.
					 Jang Hyon Chol, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said that he was greatly moved to see Kim Jong Un inspecting the front.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un ordered to deal prompt a deadly counter-blow at the enemy and lead it to a war for national reunification if even a single shell drops on the territory of the DPRK.
					
					 His order instills conviction of sure victory and courage into all members of the young vanguard and strikes terror into the enemy's hearts.
					
					 As ordered by the Supreme Commander, the West Sea will turn into a cemetery of enemy troops if they provoke a war.
					
					 Ri Chol Min, vice-chairman of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said he was greatly excited to hear the news about the Supreme Commander's inspection of the front, adding no force on earth can match the army and people of the DPRK who formed a harmonious whole in which the leader trusts people and they believe in him as in Heaven.
					
					 The enemy will never understand the single-minded unity of the Korean people more powerful than A-bombs, he stressed.
					
					 Kim Kwang Guk, chairman of the primary committee of the youth league in Oguk-ri, Anak County, said the members of young vanguard, reserve combat unit and detached force of the Supreme Commander, are waiting for the arrival of the time to wage a decisive battle, each holding a sickle or hammer in one hand and a rifle in the other.
					
					 He expressed his determination to turn out in hearty response to the order of the Supreme Commander and never miss the golden opportunity to wage a war for national reunification if aggressors hurt the dignity of the DPRK even a bit.

articles.title: DPRK People Ready for Merciless Sacred War
articles.content:
DPRK People Ready for Merciless Sacred War
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Now the situation on the Korean Peninsula has entered a touch-and-go phase due to the ongoing "Ulji Freedom Guardian" joint military exercises, kicked off by the U.S. and south Korea.     
					 Under this situation, the people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have fully prepared themselves to launch a sacred war against the provokers in hearty response to the order of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Jo Hyok Bong, an officer of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards, told KCNA:
					
					　"In defiance of our peace-loving efforts, the U.S. and south Korean regime kicked off the extremely provocative and reckless military exercises, leaving the state of armistice out of control.
					
					　An order was already issued.
					
					　If they dare preempt firing at DPRK, we will remove the root cause of war on this land with physical counteraction beyond imagination."
					
					 Sin Il Nam, a member of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards, said:
					
					 "The military exercises launched by the warmongers clearly show that the sovereignty and peace of the nation can be guaranteed only by force of arms.
					
					 A spokesman for the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army stated that the war for reunification to be waged by the DPRK will not end in armistice.
					
					 What remains to be done now is to wage a merciless sacred war for wiping out the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces to the last man and reunifying the country to win a great, admirable victory."

articles.title: Dialogue, War Incompatible
articles.content:
Dialogue, War Incompatible
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea launched a war drill against the fellow countrymen in the DPRK, while calling for dialogue and humanitarianism.
					 In this regard Prof. and Dr. Kim Yong Hwang of Kim Il Sung University sent a letter to soldiers of a frontline unit.
					
					 The academician said in his letter:
					
					 The south Korean regime reportedly proposed a reunion of family members and relatives separated in the north and the south during the Korean War (1950-1953). It is so hypocritical.
					
					 I was born in Seoul and I am eager to meet my relatives in south Korea.
					
					 The puppet regime openly arrested the vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, as soon as he returned to south Korea after visiting the DPRK, rather than expressing condolences over the great loss of the nation.
					
					 Such being a fact, it is disgusting for the puppet regime to talk about the reunion and dialogue.
					
					 It pays lip-service to humanitarianism in a bid to calm down public protest against its anti-reunification confrontation policy.
					
					 It is now staging large-scale joint military exercises in collusion with the U.S. forces.
					
					 Dialogue and war are incompatible.
					
					 I ask you, soldiers, to deal an annihilating blow to the group of traitors by launching a war for national reunification in response to the order of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Only then, can the entire Korean people enjoy a peaceful life.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition Opens on Youth Day
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Opens on Youth Day
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition "Youth, Forward Following Great Party!" was opened in Pyongyang to mark Youth Day.
					 Displayed at the exhibition hall are a photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Also display are more than 60 photos showing the leadership exploits and noble traits of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu who put forward the youth as the flowers of the country and the nation and the most viable unit of society. 
					
					 On display there are at least 120 photos of young people giving full play to their resourcefulness and valor at each construction site for a great surge.
					
					 "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung guides a meeting of the young communist league" and other photos help visitors to recollect the revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung who conducted energetic activities for the strengthening and development of the Korean youth movement.
					
					 "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il hands over torchlight of revolution to young people", "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il awards the flag of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League" and other photos deal with the undying feats of Kim Jong Il who brought up youth to be reliable successors of the Juche cause.
					
					 "The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of our party and people" and other photos show well the noble traits of Kim Jong Un who is recording the epic of great loving care with his noble outlook on the rising generation and the future.
					
					 The opening ceremony of the photo exhibition took place on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the youth league and youth and students in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Heavy Rains Bring Serious Damage to DPRK
articles.content:
Heavy Rains Bring Serious Damage to DPRK 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- There were heavy rainfalls and downpours again in the DPRK from the late evening of August 17 to the morning of August 20.
					 It rained 499 mm in Phyongsan County, 432 mm in Singye County and 360 mm in Sinphyong County in North Hwanghae Province, 494 mm in Sepho County and 433 mm in Ichon County in Kangwon Province, 303 mm in Pongchon County, South Hwanghae Province, and 285 mm in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province. It also rained much in Pyongyang and Nampho cities and South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 According to an initial survey, 3 people were confirmed dead, more than 170 houses and 30 public buildings destroyed and at least 2 740 hectares of cropland inundated, buried or washed away in North Hwanghae Province. 
					
					 The rain-triggered flood caused 2 190 cubic meters of mudslide in 38 places, leaving 6 bridges and railroad extending 1 160 meters destroyed in the province.  
					
					 In South Phyongan Province, the flood left 3 people dead, some 300 houses and 30 public and factory buildings destroyed or submerged.
					
					 Some 140 sections of roads were covered by mudslide and six bridges damaged in the province.
					
					 In South Hwanghae Province, the downpour claimed casualties and wrecked a railway bridge, causing temporary stoppage of railway service.
					
					 In Kangwon Province, a number of houses and public buildings were submerged and 280 hectares of farmland battered by flood.
					
					 Unha, Kwisong and other salterns were inundated and roads broken in Nampho City.

articles.title: Anniversary of Fact-finding Group for Forcible Drafting of Koreans Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Fact-finding Group for Forcible Drafting of Koreans Observed 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Tokyo on August 18 to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the formation of the fact-finding group for forcible drafting of Koreans.
					 Among those present there were O Kyu Sang, vice-director of the Institute for the Study of the History of Koreans in Japan, Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Society of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, members of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, officials of organizations and enterprises of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), officials of Chongryon and compatriots in various parts of Japan and Japanese people.
					
					 The floor was taken by representative from the Korean side Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee and concurrently chairman of the Rights and Welfare Committee of Chongryon.
					
					 He recalled that over the last four decades the group has conducted activities to clarify the history of damage done to Koreans in Japan during Japan's colonial rule and lay a groundwork for having human rights issues settled.
					
					 He accused the Japanese government of working hard to distort and conceal Japan's past war of aggression and crimes it committed against humanity still today when the Koreans mark the 67th anniversary of the country's liberation and the 10th anniversary of the publication of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration. He cited as examples Japan's moves to justify its past colonial rule and approval of the use of textbooks which deleted the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and monstrous massacre of Koreans during the Kanto Great Quake, etc.
					
					 The meeting heard a report entitled "Four decades of activities conducted by the fact-finding group which serve as a cornerstone for protecting the rights of Koreans in Japan" made by Akihiro Harada, co-representative of the Central Headquarters of the Japanese side to the group, and reports delivered by Kim Tong Hak, secretary general of the Human Rights Association of Koreans in Japan, Prof. Michio Sano of Housen University of Children's Education, and Etsuro Totsuka, former professor of Ryukoku University, respectively. 
					
					 An appeal was adopted at the meeting. It called for furthering the survey of the forcible drafting to carry on energetic activities to reinstate the victims and ensure the dignity of Koreans in Japan and get their legal status established.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Aggression against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities' Policy of Aggression against DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula is an inevitable product of the policy of war of aggression persistently pursued by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors against the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The south Korean conservative regime's "policy toward the north" is a policy for a war of aggression to do harm to the fellow countrymen in collusion with foreign forces and a criminal and traitorous policy blatantly challenging the desire of the nation and requirements of the times, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Watchwords "No nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" advocated by the Lee group are a version of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK aiming at "achieving unification under liberal democracy".
					
					 The puppet regime totally negated inter-Korean declarations, great programmes for reunification common to the nation. It derailed north-south dialogue and cooperation projects that had made favorable progress, by taking issue with the nuclear issue and "human rights record" in the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean war-like forces hell-bent on confrontation and war left no means untried to push the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe and ignite a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The "policy toward the north" enforced by the  Lee Myung Bak regime since it came to power stirred up the atmosphere of confrontation and war on the Korean Peninsula, not the desire for independent reunification. Now the Koreans should give momentum to the enthusiasm for independent reunification. But the Lee regime challenged them by staging Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises in August every year.
					
					 UFG clearly indicates what grave phase the U.S. imperialists and the Lee regime's moves to provoke a war against the DPRK have reached.
					
					 Now that they challenged the DPRK with UFG, its army and people are left with no option but to mercilessly wipe out the warmongers.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lauds Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Feats
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lauds Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Feats
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Songun revolutionary feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il serve as a lifeline of the country and the nation and wealth of eternal value for Kim Il Sung's nation, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a byline article.
					 The article deals with the Songun revolutionary feats performed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 He paved an ever-victorious path with his rare wisdom through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					 He laid down the philosophical principle that arms are essential for the revolution and clarified the original principle of Songun for the first time in history that the army means the party, the state and the people.
					
					 He comprehensively enforced the Songun politics and formulated it as a main political mode under socialism.
					
					 He developed the Korean People's Army into an invincible army and firmly defended the socialist country by bolstering up the country's defense capability as firm as an iron wall.
					
					 He brought about uninterrupted surge in the overall socialist construction with KPA as the core and a model.
					
					 He let the KPA play a vanguard's role and led the whole country to make a leaping advance in the soldiers spirit and with soldiers traits and mettle. 
					
					 He led the KPA to successfully perform a pioneer's role not only in the defence of the country but in socialist construction in the whole period of his revolutionary leadership.
					
					 The KPA created a progressive way of thinking, stubborn fighting spirit and creative work style that meet the requirements of the new century and new culture in the era of Songun which makes the whole country seethe with revolutionary spirit and optimism under his Songun leadership. 
					
					 He put forward the KPA as a pillar for creation and changes and translated the plan for building a thriving nation into a brilliant reality. These Songun revolutionary feats of Kim Jong Il will last forever.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Assails S. Korean Prosecution's Prejudiced Investigation into Corruptions
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Assails S. Korean Prosecution's Prejudiced Investigation into Corruptions
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- South Korean prosecution's investigation into corruptions and irregularities has enraged the south Koreans for its prejudiced and hypocritical manner.
					 The prosecution belittled and hushed up hideous grafts committed by traitor Lee Myung Bak and his close confidants, the "Saenuri Party" and Park Geun Hye side ahead of the "presidential elections", citing "no suspicion", "lack of evidence" and "private cases".
					
					 However, it has stepped up investigation into even trivial cases which the democratic reformist forces including the opposition parties are charged with. It even formed a "special team" in secrecy and has resorted to every trickery to suppress the core figures of the democratic reformist forces.
					
					 This is aimed to maintain the present conservative regime.
					
					 The prosecution has served as a waiting maid of the successive dictatorial regimes, being abused as a tool of repressing the democratic reformist forces.
					
					 After Lee Myung Bak's taking office, the prosecution dominated by Lee's close confidants who are ultra-right fascist elements, has taken the lead in suppressing the south Koreans' movement for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 The prosecution's investigation reveals the fear of a guilty man.
					
					 Fearful of the trial of history it will have to stand in the event of the replacement of the conservative regime, the prosecution has become more desperate to maintain the conservative regime by staking its fate on the upcoming "presidential elections."
					
					 It is clear that it will cook up and make public all kinds of plots against the democratic reformist forces and clamp down on them with the approach of the "presidential elections."
					
					 If the fascist prosecution is allowed to go on the rampage aligning itself with the conservative regime, it would not be possible to realize the south Koreans' desire for new politics, new life nor would it be possible to mend the north-south ties.
					
					 It is quite natural that the south Koreans of all social standings are demanding the prosecution stop prejudiced investigation and make thorough-going investigation into the hideous graft cases of traitor Lee and the "Saenuri Party's" clan.
					
					 The prosecution is bound to meet the stern punishment of history for its dishonest investigation subservient to the regime.

articles.title: S. Korea's Lee Myung Bak Blamed for Reappointing Fascist as Human Rights Chairman
articles.content:
S. Korea's Lee Myung Bak Blamed for Reappointing Fascist as Human Rights Chairman 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Hyon Pyong Chol has been reappointed as chairman of the "Human Rights Committee" of south Korea.
					 This has stirred up a terrific furor among south Koreans.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak, who is grappling with the vital issue of winning the popularity, has seated the fascist man on the chair of human rights chief of south Korea. This has naturally triggered off what Lee considered most undesirable.
					
					 The south Korean Council of Churches in a statement opposed the reappointment, saying that since his taking office in 2009 Hyon has been blamed as a coattail rider for his ignorance of human rights issue.
					
					 A spokesman for the Unified Democratic Party denounced Lee's decision of designating Hyon to the post again as an "insult to the south Koreans and a declaration of renouncement of human rights".
					
					 The reappointment of Hyon to the post is aimed to turn the "Human Rights Committee" into a waiting maid subservient to the regime and an organization breeding plots against human rights in the DPRK.
					
					 While holding the post of human rights chairman, Hyon hushed up the massacre of evacuees in Ryongsan, crackdown on candle-light demonstrators against the import of American beef, suppression of Ssangryong Motors Trade Unions, illegal surveillance of civilians and other human rights abuses by the puppet regime. It was Hyon's clan that deleted words of repealing the "National Security Law" from the "draft suggestion for the basic human rights plan".
					
					 Besides its human rights abuses, Hyon committed the whole gamut of grafts including speculation in real estate and his son's evasion of military service.
					
					 Three years ago, nearly 60 members of the human rights institution clarified their stand in group to resign on account of Hyon, touching off a big furor. This fact alone is enough to know what sort of man he is.
					
					 Irony is that he has kicked up anti-DPRK campaign, crying out for drawing up a "human rights improvement plan" and instituting "north Korean human rights law" under the pretext of its human rights performance.
					
					 For all his earlier acts, Hyon was voted down at a confirmation hearing of the "National Assembly," and even the ruling party opposed his reappointment.
					
					 However, traitor Lee Myung Bak let Hyon hold the post, a blatant challenge to human rights.
					
					 This is aimed to cover up human rights abuses Lee committed during office and continue anti-DPRK human rights campaign till the last day of his office.
					
					 This is little short of going against the people's mindset.
					
					 Imbeciles have limited thinking power.

articles.title: Koreans in China Denounce U.S.-S. Korea Joint War Drills
articles.content:
Koreans in China Denounce U.S.-S. Korea Joint War Drills
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Monday denouncing the reckless joint military war drills of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet troops. 
					 The statement said that they are going so reckless as hurling even military personnel of satellite countries into the war maneuvers against the DPRK just as they did in the last June 25 Korean War, sparking off the surging indignation of overseas Koreans. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The field inspection of the island defence detachments in the southernmost part of the southwest front, the biggest hotspots, by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un, the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, is making the will of the army and people of the DPRK to annihilate the enemy run high. 
					
					 The DPRK declared that if the U.S. imperialists and south Korean group of traitors fire even a single shell or bullet at the inviolable territory and territorial waters of the DPRK during the madcap war drills, it will immediately deal counter-blows and achieve the historic victory of national reunification. 
					
					 All the world people will witness how the power of Mt. Paektu led by the great commander will shower unimaginable fire upon the warmongers and reunify Korea. 
					
					  All the Koreans under the Zhongnan Regional Association will wage a staunch struggle till the day of national reunification true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: U.S. and Japan's Saber-rattling
articles.content:
U.S. and Japan's Saber-rattling 
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and Japan are getting frantic with war drills to launch a war of aggression in collusion. 
					 On August 19, a joint drill of U.S. Marines in Okinawa and the Japanese Ground "Self-Defense Force" was kicked off at a firing range in Oita Prefecture.
					
					 The drill which will last till August 30 will reportedly include a live-shell firing exercise, etc. with some 300 troops from each side of marines and GSDF involved.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Visit to Yasukuni Shrine Assailed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Visit to Yasukuni Shrine Assailed
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have now become desperate in their moves to realize their ambition for reinvasion.
					 They are working hard to promote militarist idea and make it pervade the Japanese society.
					
					 A typical example is the visit to Yasukuni Shrine by ultra-right politicians to pay respects to the war dead.
					
					 On August 15, ministers and Dietmen of Japan flocked to the shrine to mark the anniversary of Japan's surrender in World War II.
					
					 Among them were the chairman of the National Public Safety Commission and the minister of National Land and Communications. It is the first time that government ministers openly visited the shrine on Japan's surrender anniversary since the emergence of the Democratic Party regime in Japan.
					
					 55 Dietmen belonging to the Association of Dietmen for Visiting "Yasukuni Shrine" also flocked to the shrine.
					
					 Joining the visitors were the president of the Liberal Democratic Party, the Tokyo metropolitan governor and an official for political affairs of the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry.
					
					 Clear is the aim sought by the ultra-right politicians in taking the lead in the visit to the shrine.
					
					 After paying respects to the war dead at the shrine, Chairman of the National Public Safety Commission Matsubara told reporters that he paid respects to the forerunners who laid groundwork for Japan's prosperity, indicating his aim to lay an ideological and moral foundation for reinvasion.
					
					 Yasukuni Shrine keeps the mortuary tablets of top-class war criminals who won infamy in the Japanese imperialists' wars overseas and, therefore, it serves as a symbol of Japanese militarism and a base for inspiring it.
					
					 Through the visits the Japanese reactionaries seek to make the Japanese cherish the memory of those who fell in the war battlefields for aggression and unsheathe the sword any moment, carrying forward their "soul".
					
					 No wonder, at least 80 Dietmen paid a group visit to the shrine in April and the president and the vice-president of the Liberal Democratic Party and other high-ranking officials let loose a spate of remarks calling back the departed soul of militarism.
					
					 This is not all. The Japanese reactionaries have persisted in the moves of distorting history textbooks to cover up their past crimes and instill the militarist view of history into the rising generation.
					
					 History textbooks deleted much of the content dealing with the sexual slavery committed by the Japanese imperialists and denied Nanjing massacre.
					
					 Far from drawing a lesson from its disgraceful defeat in the past, Japan is running reckless to realize its ambition for reinvasion. It is quite natural for Asian countries and the international community to raise critical voices, deeply concerned about it.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should immediately opt for honest apology and reparation for the past crimes, not fanning up the militarist revival.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Given Publicity in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Given Publicity in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country" was carried by foreign papers and posted on Internet websites of foreign political party and organization between August 7 and 14.
					 They were the Bangladeshi papers Ekota, Natun Katha and Blits, the Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer and Internet websites of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) and the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The work made public on July 26, 2012 clarifies the essence of leader Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his life characterized by his ardent love for the country and its people.
					
					 The work also clarifies important issues in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Aug. 12 and 14 to mark the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. 
					 A photo exhibition was held in Nigeria, a seminar on his exploits and a film show in Benin and a lecture and a film show in Mongolia.
					
					 The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of the Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said what was characteristic of Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership was that he put forward the Korean People's Army as the main force for building a thriving nation and led its service personnel to make a breakthrough not only in national defence but in socialist construction.
					
					 The chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Kim Jong Il put the country's military capacity on the highest level by providing Songun leadership and brought about the unbreakable single-minded unity of the army and people around the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Referring to the fact that the DPRK ushered in a heyday in all fields under his Songun leadership, he said that its cities and villages turned into a socialist land of bliss, giving the people an ample opportunity to enjoy prosperity and luxury under socialism.
					
					 The executive chairperson of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development in a lecture said Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership has successfully been carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is successfully embodying the idea of believing in the people as in Heaven, the noble idea of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the chairperson noted, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Un is leading the struggle for realizing the grandiose plan of Kim Jong Il for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in Peru
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked in Peru
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism published a special bulletin under the headline of "General Kim Il Sung, legendary hero of the anti-Japanese armed struggle" on Aug. 14 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The bulletin carried a photo of President Kim Il Sung dating back to the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 It said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was born as the nation's sun in the darkest period when Korea was under the Japanese imperialist colonial rule.
					
					 He formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union in his early years and set forth the programme for defeating Japanese imperialism with arms. He founded the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army on April 25, 1932 and liberated Korea through bloody battles fought against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The great revolutionary exploits he performed by crushing the brigandish Japanese imperialists, achieving the country's independence and setting an example in the armed struggle against imperialism will always go down in history.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il successfully carried forward the cause of socialism and independence against imperialism pioneered by Kim Il Sung, frustrating the imperialist allied forces' moves to stifle the DPRK and protecting the destiny of Korea of Juche with his ever-victorious Songun politics.
					
					 The Peruvians and all other progressives of the world are firmly convinced that the Korean people will surely build a thriving nation and win steady victories in their cause of national reunification and independence against imperialism under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, successor to the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their cause of Songun.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups were posted on Internet websites of different countries on Aug. 13 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage photos of President Kim Il Sung and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The homepage said in an article titled "Peerless patriot":
					
					 Kim Il Sung was a peerless patriot who saved Korea from the colonial rule pursued by the Japanese imperialists and achieved the historic cause of national liberation.
					
					 That is why not only all the Koreans but the world progressives highly praise Kim Il Sung as a gifted strategist and matchless brilliant commander on every Aug. 15.
					
					 The south Koreans are also unanimous in revering him as a benefactor of national resurrection and stressing that the exploits performed by him for Korea's liberation would shine forever.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "General Kim Il Sung, legendary guerrilla" with a photo of his revolutionary activities.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The anti-Japanese armed struggle led by Kim Il Sung was a legendary guerrilla struggle unprecedented in human history.
					
					 That anti-Japanese armed struggle was well known to the world at that time.
					
					 The personality of Kim Il Sung as a great legendary guerrilla will always go down in history.
					
					 The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung for Korea's liberation".

articles.title: British Organizations Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
British Organizations Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Korea's Liberation
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Organizations in Britain spoke highly of the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in liberating Korea on the occasion of its 67th anniversary.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in their joint statement on Aug. 11 said it was thanks to the anti-Japanese armed struggle organized by Kim Il Sung that the Korean people were completely freed from the colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists on Aug. 15, 1945.
					
					 Korea's liberation was a historic event that provided the Korean people with the way of revival and helped them greet the era of independence and the nation's restoration, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Korea's liberation was not only the precious fruition of the hard-fought anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle staged by the Korean people under the banner of independence against imperialism guided by the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung but the brilliant fruition of the idea of attaching importance to army.
					
					 The struggle conducted by the Korean people for the nation's liberation under the leadership of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, invincible iron-willed and brilliant commander and gifted strategist, greatly encouraged the people of colonial countries struggling for their country's sovereignty and liberation.
					
					 The DPRK led by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un has now become a beacon of hope for the world people aspiring after independence.
					
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association released a statement on Aug. 13, referring to Korea's liberation and its historic significance.

articles.title: Photo and Fine Art Exhibition Held in Russia
articles.content:
Photo and Fine Art Exhibition Held in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A photo and fine art exhibition was held in Tveri Region of Russia on August 17 to mark the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Displayed in its venue were photos and fine art works showing celebrations held with splendor on the occasion of the centenary of birth of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and the appearance of Songun Korea.
					
					 Present there were the president of the Association of Koreans in Tveri Region, compatriots, staff members of the DPRK embassy in Moscow and a representative of the Tveri Region Government.
					
					 The participants looked round photos and fine art pieces on display.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador egipcio en Corea
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador egipcio en Corea
						
Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio este miercoles en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Ismail Abdelrahman Ghoneim Hussein, embajador egipcio en Corea, quien le realizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il se reune con Giancarlo Elia Valori
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il se reune con Giancarlo Elia Valori
						
Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Il, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, departio el dia 22 con Giancarlo Elia Valori, presidente de la Central Financiera General de Italia.

articles.title: Inaugurado simposio internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Inaugurado simposio internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado el simposio internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					En la ocasion con el tema de "Para el progreso y el prosperidad sociales", se publicaran mas de cientos de disertaciones.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar el dia 21 en la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					
					Asistieron a la ocasion el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin y el presidente del Comite de Educacion Kim Sung Du, asi como los funcionarios, los maestros y los investigadores del referido plantel docente.
					
					Participaron tambien el Prof. y Dr. Elmar Kulke, jefe de una facultad quien es el delegado de la Universidad Hummbodt de Alemania, la delegacion de la Universidad de Ciencia Aplicada Munster de Alemania presidida por el jefe de catedra Martin Weischer, la delegacion del Ministerio de Educacion de China dirigida por el director Liu Baoli, la delegacion de la Universidad de Liaoning de China presidida por su presidente Prof. y Dr. Huang Taiyan, la delegacion de la Universidad de Yanbian de China dirigida por su presidente Piao Yonghao, la delegacion de la Universidad de Jilin de China presidida por el Prof. Han Xiping, director de la Escuela Marxista, la delegacion de la Universidad del Pueblo de China presidida por el subsecretario permanente del comite de la universidad del partido Niu Weilin, el delegado subprofesor de la Universidad de Qinghua de China, Chen Weipeng, el delegado de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales de China Piao Jianyi, el delegado de la Universidad 
					
					 de Gdansk y vicepresidente de la Asociacion Internacional de Ciencia de Polonia, Marceli Burdelski y Kim Jong, delegado de la Universidad Joson de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de los Coreanos Residentes en Japon).
					
					Fueron invitados los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises acreditados en Corea.
					
					Hubo discursos de apertura y de felicitacion.
					
					El  rector de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Song Ja Rip, ministro de Educacion Superior, en su discurso inaugural que en el presente encuentro, los maestros y los cientificos de la Universidad Kim Il Sung y las universidades y los organos de investigacion cientifica de varios paises, intercambiaran sus exitos y experiencias alcanzados en el pasado en varios dominios cientificos y compartiran criterios.
					
					Expreso una conviccion de que el presente seminario servira de un motivo para estrechar el lazo de amistad entre si y intensificar el intercambio y la cooperacion.
					
					Kim Yong Jin dijo que debidamente, los educadores y los cientificos conducen el progreso de la sociedad y contribuyen el prosperidad.

articles.title: Tiene lugar seminario sobre inversiones en Rason
articles.content:
Tiene lugar seminario sobre inversiones en Rason
						
Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 21 en el terreno el seminario sobre las inversiones en la zona economico-comercial de Rason.
					El foro centro la gran atencion de los exponentes y visitantes de varios paises y regiones, incluyendo China y Rusia, que toman parte en la II Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason.
					
					Ellos vieron un video sobre la condicion geografica de la zona, el estado de desarrollo de ella y el plan perspectivo.
					
					Escucharon las explicaciones sobre la garantia legal para el desarrollo de la zona, las normas de fundacion y gestion de empresas por parte de los inversionistas extranjeros, la presentacion de las empresas de varios paises y regiones que invirtieron en la zona y la activacion del turismo, etc.
					
					Kim Yong Nam (46 anos de edad), subdirector del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Rason, dijo que la zona de Rason sera construida en 10 anos futuros como base internacional de intermediacion, transporte, comercio exterior, inversion, circulacion financiera, turismo y servicios y como ciudad portuaria de talla mundial.
					
					Zhang Xingquan (60 anos de edad), director general de Siping Lishan Machinery Manufacturing, Co. Ltd, senalo que es muy util el desarrollo de la zona de Rason y expuso su voluntad de fundar en esta ciudad una empresa mixta.
